generif.text: Ctc1-Stn1-Ten1 is a replication protein A (RPA)-like complex that is not directly involved in conventional DNA replication at forks but plays a role in DNA metabolism frequently required by telomeres.

the human CST (CTC1, STN1 and TEN1) complex, previously implicated in telomere protection and DNA metabolism, inhibits telomerase activity through primer sequestration and physical interaction with the protection of telomeres 1 (POT1)-TPP1 telomerase processivity factor
data indicate that hTen1 is critical for the telomeric function of hCST, both in telomere protection and downregulation of telomerase function

The mammalian CST (CTC1-STN1-TEN1) complex is directly involved at several stages of telomere end formation and CST seems to play critical roles in coordinating telomerase elongation and fill-in synthesis to complete telomere replication.
TEN1 likely functions in conjunction with CTC1 and STN1 at the telomere and elsewhere in the genome.

reveal a critical role for human Stn1 in telomere length maintenance and function, supporting the model that efficient replication of telomeric repeats is critical for long-term viability of normal somatic mammalian cells
CTC1/STN1/TEN1 (CST) deficiency diminishes HU-induced RAD51 foci formation.
TERT-mediated G-strand extension and Ctc1-Stn1-Ten1-mediated C-strand fill-in are equally important for telomere length maintenance.
The findings imply that theCTC1/STN1/TEN1 complex(CST )complex plays an important role in regulating telomere maintenance in alternative-lengthening of telomeres(ALT) cells.
Studies indicate telomere-binding proteins CTC1-STN1-TEN1 (CST) dysfunction and mutation is associated with several genetic diseases and cancers [Review].
CTC1-STN1 terminates TERT while STN1-TEN1 enables C-strand synthesis during telomere replication in colon cancer cells.
The CST complex (CTC1-STN1-TEN1) maintains genome integrity through resolution of G4 structures both ahead of the replication fork and on the lagging strand template
CST functions in two distinct aspects of genome-wide DNA replication, namely, origin licensing and replisome assembly. CST interacts with additional replisome components, MCM and AND-1.
This work provides a blueprint to pinpoint the possible consequences of pathogenic mutations in the CST complex subunit TEN1.
An Indian child with Coats plus syndrome due to mutations in STN1.
Human CST complex protects stalled replication forks by directly blocking MRE11 degradation of nascent-strand DNA.
CST in maintaining genome stability: Beyond telomeres.
Pan-cancer analysis reveals that CTC1-STN1-TEN1 (CST) complex may have a key position in oncology.
Structures of the human CST-Polalpha-primase complex bound to telomere templates.
Reconstitution of a telomeric replicon organized by CST.
CST-polymerase alpha-primase solves a second telomere end-replication problem.

BP.term: negative regulation of telomere maintenance via telomerase
negative regulation of telomere maintenance via telomerase

reactome.name: Polymerase switching on the C-strand of the telomere

summary: C17ORF106, or TEN1, appears to function in a telomere-associated complex with STN1 (OBFC1; MIM 613128) and CTC1 (C17ORF68; MIM 613129) (Miyake et al., 2009 [PubMed 19854130]).[supplied by OMIM, Nov 2009].
